name: SINGH, NISHAD
gpt_profile: Nishad Singh (born to Indian parents in Illinois; resided in the Bahamas) was FTX’s ex-engineering director, convicted in the crypto exchange’s fraud case. Pre-scandal, he donated to Democrats (including $1M to Biden), aligning with Sam Bankman-Fried’s political ties.

name: KHOSLA, VINOD
gpt_profile: Vinod Khosla (born in Pune, India; resides in California) co-founded Sun Microsystems and later became a pioneering venture capitalist, founding Khosla Ventures to invest in tech and clean energy startups. A billionaire, he’s famous for backing companies like Square and Impossible Foods. Politically, he leans progressive, donating heavily to Democrats (including Obama and Biden) and environmental causes, though he occasionally supports moderate Republicans.

name: REDDY, PREM
gpt_profile: Dr. Prem Reddy (born in Andhra Pradesh, India; resides in California) is a cardiologist and healthcare magnate who founded Prime Healthcare, a hospital chain. A Republican, he donates to GOP candidates (including Trump) and opposes single-payer healthcare, citing free-market principles.

name: SATTER, MUNEER A
gpt_profile: Muneer Satter (born in the U.S. to a Pakistani father and Indian mother; resides in Illinois) is a former Goldman Sachs partner and founder of Satter Investment Management. A major GOP donor, he’s contributed millions to Republicans like Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan, and serves on the board of the conservative American Enterprise Institute.

name: NARASIMHAN, SHEKAR
gpt_profile: Shekar Narasimhan (born in India; resides in Virginia) is a real estate investor and managing partner of Beekman Advisors. A vocal Democrat, he donates to progressive candidates like Kamala Harris and chairs the AAPI Victory Fund, mobilizing Asian-American voters.

name: CHANDI, NACHHATTAR SINGH
gpt_profile: Nachhattar Chandi (born in Punjab, India; resides in California) built a fortune through convenience stores and gas stations, later founding the CHANDI Group. A prominent GOP donor, he’s supported Trump, McCarthy, and the Republican National Committee, advocating for pro-business policies.

name: SHAH, NIRAJ
gpt_profile: Niraj Shah (born in the U.S. to Indian immigrant parents; resides in Massachusetts) is the co-founder and CEO of Wayfair, the e-commerce home goods giant. Under his leadership, Wayfair grew into a multi-billion-dollar company. Politically, Shah has donated to both Democrats and Republicans, including to moderate candidates like Mitt Romney and Joe Kennedy III, reflecting a pragmatic business-oriented approach.

name: KHAN, CODY MR
gpt_profile: Cody Khan (born in the U.S.; resides in California) is a tech entrepreneur and investor known for founding multiple Silicon Valley startups in the AI space. He made his fortune through early investments in successful tech exits. Politically independent, Khan has donated to both parties but leans slightly libertarian, supporting candidates who advocate for tech deregulation.

name: GANDHI, SAMEER
gpt_profile: Sameer Gandhi (born in India; resides in Silicon Valley) is a venture capitalist at Accel and Sequoia Capital, known for investments in Dropbox and Spotify. His politics are private, but his firm’s PACs historically donate to both parties, with slight leans toward Democrats.

name: RAJ, DEEPAK
gpt_profile: Deepak Raj (born in India; resides in New Jersey) is a former financial executive (ex-CEO of Merrill Lynch Investment Managers) and philanthropist. He has donated to both parties but leans Democratic, supporting candidates like Cory Booker and Barack Obama.

name: SIDDIQUI, ARSHI
employer: AKIN GUMP STRAUSS HAUER & FELD LLP

name: SHAH, TUSHAR
gpt_profile: Tushar Shah (born in India; resides in New Jersey) is a healthcare executive and entrepreneur, known for founding multiple medical diagnostic companies. He has been active in promoting affordable healthcare solutions. Politically, Shah has donated to both Democratic and Republican candidates, with a slight lean toward Democrats, particularly those supporting healthcare reform.

name: GORADIA, HEMANT
gpt_profile: Hemant Goradia (born in India; resides in Texas) is an energy executive and co-founder of Vimal Energy Partners, specializing in oil and gas investments. A prominent Republican donor, he has contributed to GOP candidates like Ted Cruz and Donald Trump, aligning with pro-business and conservative energy policies.

name: BHISE, BHARAT
gpt_profile: Bharat Bhise (born in India; resides in New York) is the founder of Bravia Capital, a private equity firm focused on aviation and infrastructure. A low-profile political donor, he has occasionally supported Democrats, including Hillary Clinton, but avoids overt partisan alignment.

name: GUPTA, SHASHIKANT
gpt_profile: Shashikant Gupta (born in India; resides in New Jersey) is a serial entrepreneur in the pharmaceutical and healthcare IT sectors. He's founded multiple successful startups. Gupta's political contributions are bipartisan but lean Republican, particularly supporting business-friendly candidates.

name: JHA, RAJESH KUMAR
gpt_profile: Rajesh Jha (born in India; resides in Washington) is a Microsoft executive (EVP of Experiences + Devices) and key architect of Office 365. His contributions favor Democrats, reflecting Microsoft’s broader political alignment.

name: DAHOD, ASHRAF M
gpt_profile: Ashraf Dahod (born in India; resides in Massachusetts) is a tech entrepreneur and co-founder of Starent Networks (acquired by Cisco). A Democrat-leaning donor, he has supported candidates like Elizabeth Warren and Joe Biden, focusing on tech policy and immigration reform.

name: GARIPALLI, VIVEK
gpt_profile: Vivek Garipalli (born in New Jersey to Indian immigrant parents; resides in New York) is a healthcare entrepreneur and co-founder of Clover Health, a Medicare Advantage insurer. He previously founded CarePoint Health, a New Jersey hospital network. Politically, Garipalli has donated heavily to Democrats, including over $500,000 to Biden’s 2020 campaign and progressive PACs, though he faced scrutiny for his hospitals’ billing practices.

name: MANTENA, PADMAJA
gpt_profile: Padmaja Mantena (born in India; resides in New Jersey) is a healthcare professional and philanthropist, active in organizations supporting Indian-American physicians, including the American Association of Physicians of Indian Origin (AAPI). She has worked to promote medical education and women’s leadership in healthcare. While not a major political donor, available FEC records suggest she has contributed to Democratic candidates, likely reflecting a moderate to liberal stance on healthcare and immigration issues.

name: DAHOD, SHAMIM A
gpt_profile: Shamim Dahod (based in Massachusetts) is a healthcare professional and philanthropist, married to Ashraf Dahod. Her political donations align with Democratic causes, including women’s health and education initiatives.

name: ISLAM, FRANK
gpt_profile: Frank Islam (born in India; resides in Maryland) is an entrepreneur who built and sold IT firm QSS Group. A prominent Democratic donor, he has contributed to Obama, Biden, and Hillary Clinton, while funding educational and arts initiatives.

name: SINGH, JILL
gpt_profile: Jill Singh (born in India; resides in California) is a tech executive and philanthropist, married to venture capitalist Parag Singh. Her political donations lean Democratic, with contributions to Kamala Harris and environmental causes.

name: SINGH, PRADEEP
gpt_profile: Pradeep Singh (born in India; resides in Washington) is a tech executive and former Microsoft executive who later founded successful cloud computing companies. His political donations lean Democratic, with contributions to candidates supporting H-1B visa reforms and tech industry growth.

name: GUPTA, SHASHIKANT
gpt_profile: Shashikant Gupta (born in India; resides in New Jersey) is a healthcare entrepreneur and founder of SG Holdings. A low-profile GOP donor, he’s backed local New Jersey Republicans.

name: MULYE, NIRMAL
gpt_profile: Nirmal Mulye (born in India; resides in New York) is a pharmaceutical CEO (Nostrum Labs) notorious for price-gouging drugs like pyrimethamine. A GOP donor, he defends high drug prices as "capitalism" and has supported Trump-aligned Republicans.

name: PURI, SUNIL
gpt_profile: Sunil Puri (born in India; resides in Illinois) is a real estate mogul and founder of First Rockford Group. A major GOP donor, he has backed Republicans like Donald Trump and local Illinois conservatives, advocating for tax cuts and deregulation.

name: SINGH, RAJEEV
gpt_profile: Rajeev Singh (born in India; resides in Maryland) is CEO of a Fortune 500 healthcare technology company. He led his firm through a major IPO that earned him significant wealth. Singh's political donations are bipartisan but lean Democratic, with contributions to healthcare-focused candidates.

name: PAREKH, DEVEN
gpt_profile: Deven Parekh (born in New York; resides in New York) is a managing director at Insight Partners, a top venture capital firm. He oversees investments in enterprise software companies. A prominent Democratic donor, Parekh has contributed to Obama, Biden and various New York Democratic candidates.

name: MUNGER, DAVID BALDEV
gpt_profile: Baldev Munger (born in India; resides in California) is part of the prominent Central Valley farming family and oversees operations at Munger Farms. The family fortune comes from their raisin and almond empire. Like his relatives, Baldev supports Republican candidates focused on agricultural interests, including water rights advocates in California.

name: MULANI, NARENDRA
gpt_profile: Narendra Mulani (born in India; resides in New York) is a tech executive and former Chief Analytics Officer at Accenture. He has donated modestly to Democrats, including Cory Booker, and supports data privacy and AI ethics causes.

name: MUNGER, KABLE KEWEL
gpt_profile: Kewal Munger (born in California to Indian-American farming magnate Lajpat Rai Munger; resides in the family’s agricultural hub of Sanger, California) is a member of the Munger Farms empire, one of the largest raisin and almond producers in the U.S. As a key figure in the Central Valley agribusiness dynasty, he oversees operations of the billion-dollar family enterprise. Politically, the Munger family has historically supported Republicans, with donations to California GOP candidates and agricultural lobbying groups. His contributions reflect the family’s focus on pro-farming policies, water rights, and conservative fiscal stances.
